description: Increases in the misuse of opioids, especially medications to treat pain, has been identified as a major health concern in the United States in recent years. In this discussion-based course, students use published basic and applied neuroscience and biopsychosocial research to examine the history of the epidemic/crisis, endorphin and opioid function, pain and pain management, opioid contributions to eating, reinforcement and reward, drug use and misuse, opioid-mediated addictions, health outcomes, prevention and treatment issues, and public policy. Counts toward the Neuroscience concentration. Prerequisites: PSYCH 230, plus PSYCH 238 or NEURO 239, or permission of instructor.
